questions.text: A 30-year-old woman with myopia for the last 20 years wants to eliminate her spectacles. She attended an ophthalmologic clinic for the preoperative evaluation. Which of the following are the components of ophthalmic examination? Measure both best corrected and uncorrected VA Dry retinoscopy to find the correct spectacle correction. Wet retinoscopy to find the correct spectacle correction. Jone’s basal tear secretion rate Slit lamp examination- fluorescein and vital stain. Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1,3,4,5 In the given question, as asked about the preoperative evaluation for the refractive surgery , the following things in the ophthalmic examination should be done- Statement 1 - Measure both best corrected and uncorrected VA Statement 2 - wet retinoscopy to find the correct spectacle correction- to look for latent or facultative hypermetropia. Statement 3 - Jone’s basal tear secretion rate needs to be done as dry eye is a severe complication of refractive surgery. Statement 4 - Slit lamp examination - fluorescein and vital stain- to look for superficial ulcers or any evidence of dry eye on the cornea. Ocular motility Statement 5 Gross inspection of all the other structures.

questions.text: During the preoperative evaluation of a 28-year-old male who wants to undergo refractive surgery for his myopia, the ophthalmologist informs him that he cannot undergo this surgery as he does not meet the criteria for the residual central corneal thickness. Which of the following instruments can measure the thickness throughout the cornea?

options.label: B
options.text: Specular microscope

options.label: C
options.text: Pachymeter

options.label: D
options.text: Orbscan device

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Orbscan device In the given question, although it is mentioned that the patient does not have a sufficient residual central corneal thickness measured with the help of a pachymeter, the question asked is about the thickness measurement throughout the cornea done with the use of an orbscan device.

Highyeild:

Orbscan combines two principle Placido disc Scanning slit

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. keratometer measures the corneal curvature. Option: B. Pachymeter is used to measure the central corneal thickness. Option: C. Specular microscope counts the number of endothelial cells left and can be helpful during a corneal transplant.

questions.text: A 28-year-old male with -3D of myopia wanted to undergo refractive surgery due to cosmesis. After a normal preoperative evaluation, he was planned to undergo the following surgery as given in the image below, Labeled as A, and the instrument used in the surgery is also shown in image B. questions.correct_answer: A. Radial cuts on the epithelial side of the cornea to the stroma.

Solution:

Radial cuts on the epithelial side of the cornea to the stroma. In the given question, image A depicts radial keratotomy , a refractive surgery done for mild to moderate myopia with the help of a diamond knife, as shown in image B. The correct description for the incision given during this surgery includes – radial cuts on the epithelial side of the cornea to the stroma with the help of the diamond knife. It is shown until stroma only to decrease the risk of perforation.

questions.text: You are attending a seminar on the various new advances in refractive surgery. One such topic dealt with is the use of Femtosecond laser. Which of the following statements regarding the femtosecond laser is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: It uses infrared waves of 1053 nm wavelength.

options.label: B
options.text: It has low power as pulse time is very short.

options.label: C
options.text: Each pulse of focussed laser light lasts approximately 10^-15 seconds, i.e. 500-800 femtoseconds.

options.label: D
options.text: Penetration power is more due to more wavelength.

questions.correct_answer: B. It has low power as pulse time is very short.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It has low power as pulse time is very short. In the above question, the false statement about the femtosecond laser is – it has low power as pulse time is short. The femtosecond laser has more power due to a shorter pulse time. This laser has gained much importance in ophthalmologic procedures as it is used in FLACS also.

Highyeild:

Indications : Wounds Arcuate keratotomies Anterior capsulotomies Nuclear fragmentation

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. uses infrared waves of 1053 nm wavelength is a correct statement. Option: C. Each pulse of focussed laser light lasts approximately 10^-15 seconds, i.e. 500-800 femtoseconds is a correct statement. Option: D. Penetration power is more due to more wavelength is also a correct statement.

questions.text: A 27-year-old is undergoing LASIK surgery. The senior staff is guiding his resident through the steps of the procedure. Which of the following is incorrect regarding the procedure?

options.label: A
options.text: Hinged flap of 120–150 mm thickness is created

options.label: B
options.text: Microkeratome is used to raise a flap of epithelium

options.label: C
options.text: 250 mm thickness stromal bed is left behind

options.label: D
options.text: Vicryl sutures are used to reposit flap

questions.correct_answer: D. Vicryl sutures are used to reposit flap
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vicryl sutures are used to reposit flap LASIK is a procedure where sutures are not placed . The epithelial flap is reposited without sutures.

Highyeild:

In LASIK surgery, the following steps are followed - Corneal anaesthesia Corneal marking Fixation of the suction ring to raise IOP by 65 mm of hg. The cornea is moistened with BSS (basal salt solution) for smooth movement. A thin flap of (130-160u) corneal tissue is raised using a microkeratome. Suction pressure was removed. The flap is moistened, and the surface is dried. Excimer laser- reshapes the cornea by removing the precise amount of tissue. The corneal flap is repositioned nasally.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options: A, B, and C . The superficial, circular hinged epithelium flap and stroma are created with an automated, sharp blade called a The hinged flap of 120–150 mm thickness is lifted, and the stromal bed is ablated with a laser to precisely sculpt the cornea to the desired extent, ensuring a minimum residual stromal bed thickness of 250 mm to maintain adequate corneal biomechanical stability and prevent iatrogenic ectasia. Following this, the flap is reposited without sutures.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding photorefractive keratectomy?

options.label: A
options.text: Laser ablation of the corneal surface

options.label: B
options.text: Arc-shaped incisions in myopic meridian

options.label: C
options.text: Attachment of a donor corneal tissue over the host cornea

options.label: D
options.text: Resection and modification of corneal tissue followed by replacement

questions.correct_answer: A. Laser ablation of the corneal surface
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Laser ablation of the corneal surface Photorefractive keratectomy (PRK) is a type of excimer laser refractive surgery in which the cornea's surface is ablated by laser in the procedure. This results in a flattened cornea to neutralise

Highyeild:

Complications Dry eyes Poor night vision Glares or halos Light sensitivity corneal haze

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B .Arc-shaped incisions are made in a procedure called arcuate keratotomy, where the incisions are made in the steeper or more myopic meridian to reduce astigmatism. Option: C. Epikeratophakia is a type of refractive keratoplasty to modify the cornea's refractive power. In this, a donor corneal tissue is attached to the host cornea after removal of the epithelium. Option: D . Keratomileusis is a type of refractive keratoplasty to modify the cornea's refractive power. The corneal tissue is resected and altered in shape before replacement.

Extraedge:

Photorefractive keratectomy uses an Excimer laser , an argon fluoride laser of wavelength 193 nm.

Photorefractive keratectomy The excimer laser has now supplanted other methods as it modifies the shape of the cornea with great accuracy and without inflammatory reaction. Excimer laser refractive surgery is of two types- photorefractive keratectomy (PRK) and laser-assisted in situ keratomileusis (LASIK)

Complications Dry eyes Poor night vision Glares or halos Light sensitivity corneal haz

Extraedge:

Photorefractive keratectomy uses an Excimer laser , an argon fluoride laser of wavelength 193 nm.

questions.correct_answer: A. Femtosecond laser is used in photorefractive keratectomy
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Femtosecond laser is used in photorefractive keratectomy Photorefractive keratectomy uses an Excimer laser , an argon fluoride laser of wavelength 193 nm. It does not use a femtosecond

Highyeild:

Advantages of Photo refractive keratectomy : PRK can accurately correct nearsightedness. Approximately 90% of PRK patients have 20/20 vision without glasses or contact lenses one year after the surgery.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B . Excimer laser is used in LASEK and other procedures like photorefractive keratectomy (PRK), phototherapeutic keratectomy (PTK) and LASIK. PRK may be preferable to LASIK in certain patients with thinner corneas or with the corneal surface irregularity since PRK disrupts less corneal tissue than a comparable LASIK surgery.

questions.text: A 28-year-old female patient presents to the OPD wanting surgical correction for her myopia, for which she has been wearing spectacles for 12 years. The doctor plans to undergo a LASIK procedure. Which of the following is incorrect regarding LASIK?

options.label: A
options.text: Visual rehabilitation is quicker

options.label: B
options.text: Raising the superficial flap of the epithelium to ablate the stroma bed

options.label: C
options.text: 100mm thickness of the stromal bed is left out

options.label: D
options.text: Excimer laser is used

questions.correct_answer: C. 100mm thickness of the stromal bed is left out
questions.explanation:
Solution:

100mm thickness of the stromal bed is left out A minimum of 250 mm thickness of the stromal bed is left out during LASIK to maintain adequate corneal biomechanical stability and prevent iatrogenic ectasia.

Highyeild:

LASEK stands for Laser subepithelial keratomileusis. It carries the combined feature of both PRK and LASIK. In this, 20% alcohol treatment for 1 min is used to remove the flap, unlike in LASIK, where we use a microkeratome to raise the flap.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A . LASIK has the advantages of quicker visual rehabilitation, clearer vision as Bowman’s membrane is not damaged and the ability to correct higher degrees of refractive error. Option: B .In LASIK, a superficial epithelium flap is raised and the stromal bed is ablated. A minimum of 250 mm thickness of the stromal bed is left out. Option: D . Excimer laser is used to carry out LASIK.

Extraedge:

Contraindications include unstable refractive error , active collagen vascular disease (especially in the presence of iritis or scleritis), pregnancy, presence of a pacemaker, any ongoing active inflammation of the external eye (e.g., conjunctivitis, severe dry eye), and a refractive error outside the range of laser correction, age less than 18 years. Other contraindications include leaving less than a calculated residual bed of 250 µm of the untouched cornea and signs, symptoms, or topographic findings consistent with keratoconus.

questions.text: In refractive surgery, the surgeon attaches donor corneal tissue to the host cornea after removal of the epithelium. What is the name of the procedure?

options.label: A
options.text: Keratomileusis

options.label: B
options.text: Epikeratophakia

options.label: C
options.text: Photorefractive keratectomy

options.label: D
options.text: Radial keratotomy

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Epikeratophakia Epikeratophakia is a type of refractive keratoplasty to modify the cornea's refractive power. In this, a donor corneal tissue is attached to the host cornea after removal of the epithelium.

Highyeild:

Indications of Epikeratophakia : Treatment of Keratoconus Refractive errors like myopia and high hypermetropia, including aphakia, cannot be corrected with conservative methods.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. In keratomileusis , corneal tissue is resected and modified in shape before replacement. Option: C. Photorefractive keratectomy (PRK) is a type of excimer laser refractive surgery in which the cornea's surface is ablated by laser in the procedure. Option: D. Radial keratotomy is a technique in which radial incisions are made in the cornea.

Extraedge:

Common Complications of epikeratophakia include delayed postoperative visual recovery reduced best-corrected visual acuity prolonged epithelial defects irregular astigmatism
